title: Inside Canva: Coaches not managers, giving away your Legos, and embracing AI | Cameron Adams
key_insights: Focus on creating joyful user experiences rather than rushing to launch an MVP - Canva spent a year building before launch to ensure user delight
Give away your Legos: embrace handing off responsibilities to scale personally and organizationally as the company grows
Use coaching instead of traditional management - Canva has 800+ internal coaches helping employees grow in their specialties
Internationalization can be a massive growth driver - Canva went from 5 to 100+ languages and now has top markets in Brazil, India, and Indonesia
SEO success requires end-to-end experience design from search query to magic moment, not just technical optimization
Freemium should align with mission, not just be a growth hack - Canva's free tier supports their goal of democratizing design
AI integration should enhance core value proposition rather than being technology for technology's sake
Visual communication in product development - teams should prototype and mock up ideas rather than just discuss them

guest_background.current_role: Co-founder and Chief Product Officer at Canva

topics_discussed: Canva's massive scale and growth metrics
Social media manager as initial target market
Internal coaching system vs traditional management
AI integration strategy and three-pillar approach
memorable_quotes: We don't really have managers, but everyone at Canva has a coach. They're constantly working with you to look at your skills, but also when it might be time to move on to the next level.
I didn't know I could be a designer. And that was what we managed to do through several rounds of refinement on the onboarding process.

We view AI as the next way of democratizing design and empowering the world to design, helping more people design, helping more people design quicker, helping more people design quicker with better quality.
frameworks_mentioned: Three-pillar AI strategy (build own tech, partner with best, app ecosystem)
summary: Cameron Adams shares how Canva built a $2.3B ARR business through product obsession, unique cultural practices like internal coaching, and strategic decisions around MVP timing, freemium models, and AI integration. The episode provides tactical insights on scaling teams, growth strategies, and maintaining product focus at enterprise scale.
